intro: Helipterum variabile, commonly known as the variable helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets that give it a daisy-like appearance. Helipterum variabile is an annual or biennial plant that thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid environments.
